title: How AI Could Restore Trust in Democratic Governance
content: The key to success for high-trust technocracies like Singapore and the United Arab Emirates is that they have figured out how to deliver visible policy results while remaining responsive to ever-evolving public concerns. Now, new AI tools help low-trust democracies do the same.
creator: Sami Mahroum

title: The Time Has Come to Shutter the World Economic Forum
content: As a place where political and business leaders can enjoy one another’s company, the World Economic Forum's annual Davos gathering has been an incubator for standards that have shaped the global economy. But the Davos order is now crumbling, and if regular attendees had bothered to consult ordinary people, they might understand why.
creator: Katharina Pistor

title: American Democracy After Trump
content: America's current dysfunction - as exemplified by Trumpism and the decline of democracy - stems from the massive rise of private power and the deep inequalities it has produced. As the root causes of everything that has gone wrong since the 1980s, these are where any project of national rejuvenation must begin.
creator: Mordecai Kurz

title: Is China’s Economic Policy Too Cautious?
content: Recognizing that the old growth model has run its course, China’s leaders have embraced a measured economic strategy, focused on “high-quality development,” stability, and risk management. But they must not be so cautious that they fail to address the imbalances that may become hard constraints on the economy's long-term prospects.
creator: Lee Jong-Wha

title: AI and the Future of Education
content: The central challenge for educators in the age of AI is to prepare students to operate effectively in the face of uncertainty. The answer is not to train them for specific tasks that may soon become obsolete, but to make them as adaptable and intellectually independent as possible.
creator: Pinelopi Koujianou Goldberg

title: Appeasing Trump Only Invites Betrayal - as Europe’s Far Right Just Learned
content: With Donald Trump laying claim to Greenland, Europeans have finally realized who they are dealing with. The US president is animated less by the prospect of deal-making than by the need for domination, less by the spirit of exchange than by the perverse pleasure of belittling others and exalting himself.
creator: Stephen Holmes

title: Why AI Is Unlike Previous Tech Booms
content: The rise of AI follows a fundamentally different competitive logic than earlier technological revolutions. With massive capital requirements, high operating expenses, low switching costs, and intensifying regulatory scrutiny, success will depend less on scale and more on financial resilience and political influence.
creator: Dambisa Moyo

title: Scott Bessent Is in Denial – and the Bond Market Is Watching
content: Far from warning Donald Trump against undermining foreign investors’ confidence in the US, his Treasury secretary is backing the president and downplaying the risks of a bond selloff. But markets are telling a different story.
creator: Desmond Lachman

title: Trump’s Imperialism Without Alibis
content: By asserting control over Venezuela’s primary sources of revenue, US President Donald Trump has replaced the moral rhetoric of his predecessors with a 21st-century version of colonial-era indirect rule. The result is a country that retains the symbols of self-government but functions as an American protectorate.
creator: Ricardo Hausmann

title: Philanthropy Must Dive Deeper to Save the Ocean
content: Despite growing pressure on marine ecosystems, ocean-health projects often remain underdeveloped because funding, policy, and implementation fail to move in sync. Philanthropy can help change that by aligning priorities, absorbing early risks, and providing the coordinating capacity that enables promising ideas to scale.
creator: Shaun Seow

title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Is Trapped
content: Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has built a system that survives only through repression. Yet now, a man who has never been willing to retreat confronts a dilemma from which there is no clean exit: continued internal war against his own people, or an external war that exposes his regime's fragility.
creator: Pegah Banihashemi

title: The Authoritarian Illusion
content: The debate and uncertainty that are intrinsic to democracies have started to look like weaknesses alongside the order and continuity promised by authoritarian regimes. But democracy is resilient and keeps returning in different forms, simultaneously obsolete and ahead of its time.
creator: Jacques Attali

title: Europe Needs a New Security Framework
content: Recent developments have made clear that neither NATO nor the European Union is fully suited to meet the mounting challenges that Europe faces. They have also strengthened the case for reviving the old Western European Union, by institutionalizing the “coalition of the willing” that France, Germany, and the UK have already forged.
creator: Carl Bildt

title: Escaping the French Budget Maze
content: A recent experiment involving 150 French citizens shows that when the conditions for achieving fiscal sustainability are clear and the trade-offs transparent, voters are prepared to support difficult budgetary decisions. What has been missing from the current process is not consent, but an effective method.
creator: Eric Hazan

title: Can China Reverse Its Demographic Decline?
content: After decades of the one-child policy, the decline in China's fertility rate was inevitable, like a boulder rolling down a hill. With the problem now being compounded by numerous other factors, pushing the boulder back uphill will be exceedingly difficult, if not impossible, and will not happen quickly.
creator: Yi Fuxian

title: Saudi Arabia’s Stock Market Goes Global
content: Saudi Arabia recently opened its stock exchange, Tadawul, to all foreign investors, an important structural shift for the Gulf region. But when deciding whether to invest, foreigners will scrutinize the quality of the exchange's corporate-governance regulations, which will likely need to be fine-tuned.
creator: Alissa Kole

title: Rogue America Is Changing the Global Economic Outlook
content: Since the year began, US President Donald Trump has ramped up his aggression in the Western Hemisphere, including military intervention in Venezuela and threats to impose large sanctions on European Union countries that oppose US annexation of Greenland. Suddenly, the international order – institutions, understandings, and alliances – that underpinned economic growth for generations are at risk.
creator: PS Commentators

title: The Big Picture
creator: PS editors

title: Trump’s Robber-Baron Imperialism
content: By normalizing territorial predation and treating foreign policy as a vehicle for personal enrichment, Donald Trump is putting America’s economy and credibility at risk. Democrats and Republicans who oppose Trump must speak up now or inherit a world where US prosperity and security have been damaged beyond repair.
creator: James C. O'Brien

title: Europe Needs Joint Financing and Procurement to Defend Itself
content: Despite rising military spending, the European Union’s defense capabilities remain constrained by fragmented procurement, uneven national budgets, and weak coordination. Bolstering resilience and reducing dependence on the United States will require mobilizing resources at the European level.
creator: Ulrike Malmendier
